comments.html: HTTP redirects don't give you high availability. If a particular back-end server fails, all clients redirected to it lose service.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
There are switches that can do consistent hashing, e.g. Broadcom: http://www.broadcom.com/collateral/wp/StrataXGS_SmartSwitch-WP200-R.pdf

In this case, upon failure of a switch only 1/N of flows get rehashed ( i.e. the ones that were hashing to the failed LB ).

In case of a web site, couldn't you simply use a set of HTTP redirect based load balancers?
comments.name: Jeroen van Bemmel
